text: Easy 1-Pot Tikka Masala
label: title

text: Ingredients
label: header

text: 3 Tbsp avocado oil (or sub ghee if not vegan)
label: ingredient

text: 1 medium white or yellow onion, finely diced
label: ingredient

text: 1 Tbsp ground cumin
label: ingredient

text: 1 tsp sea salt (DIVIDED // plus more to taste)
label: ingredient

text: 6 cloves garlic, minced (6 cloves yield ~3 Tbsp)
label: ingredient

text: 2 Tbsp fresh minced ginger
label: ingredient

text: 1 medium red bell pepper, seeds and stems removed, halved then sliced lengthwise
label: ingredient

text: 1 ½ Tbsp minced green chili, stems and seeds removed (use serrano or jalapeño)
label: ingredient

text: 1 boneless skinless chicken breast, cubed
label: ingredient

text: 1 Tbsp ground coriander
label: ingredient

text: 1/4 tsp red chili flake (omit for less heat)
label: ingredient

text: 1 tsp ground turmeric
label: ingredient

text: 1 tsp smoked paprika
label: ingredient

text: 2 15-ounce cans diced tomatoes (if unsalted, you’ll add more salt to the dish) BLEND ONE CAN FOR SMOOTHER TEXTURE
label: ingredient

text: 1 15-ounce can chickpeas, slightly drained (if omitting chicken, double quantity of chickpeas)
label: ingredient

text: 1 Tbsp garam masala* (see notes for DIY blend)
label: ingredient

text: 1-2 Tbsp coconut sugar
label: ingredient

text: 1 14-ounce can full-fat coconut milk (sub light coconut milk for less fat)
label: ingredient

text: White or brown rice
label: ingredient

text: Fresh cilantro, chopped
label: ingredient

text: Fresh jalapeño (omit for less heat)
label: ingredient

text: Instructions
label: header

text: Heat a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Once hot, add oil, onion, cumin, and one-third of the salt (1/3 tsp as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size). Sauté for 2-3 minutes.
label: step

text: Add garlic, ginger, bell pepper, and green chili and stir. Sauté for 2-3 minutes.
label: step

text: Next add chicken breast (or omit if not adding — you’ll double up on chickpeas later), ground coriander, chili flake, turmeric, and paprika and stir to coat. Add another one-third of the salt (1/3 tsp as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size). Sauté for 3 minutes, stirring frequently.
label: step

text: Next add diced tomatoes (optional: purée one of the cans of tomatoes in a small blender before adding for a creamier sauce). Then add chickpeas, garam masala, coconut sugar, and remaining salt (1/3 tsp as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size).
label: step

text: Increase heat to medium high until it reaches a rolling simmer, then reduce heat to low or medium-low and maintain a simmer (uncovered) for 15-20 minutes or until thick and stew-like. Stir occasionally.
label: step

text: Add coconut milk and stir to combine. Simmer for 5 minutes on medium-low heat. Then taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more salt to taste, chili flake (or a pinch of cayenne) for heat, coconut sugar for sweetness, cumin or paprika for smokiness, or garam masala for a more spiced / earthy flavor.
label: step

text: Garnish with fresh cilantro and jalapeños for added heat (optional). Can be enjoyed as a stew, or with white or brown rice or cauliflower rice. Another favorite is serving over roasted sweet potatoes.
label: step

text: Leftovers will keep covered in the refrigerator up to 4-5 days, or in the freezer up to 1 month.
label: step
